verses.verse: Now the Feast of Unleavened Bread was drawing near, which was called the Passover.
The chief priests and scribes were seeking a way to kill Jesus, because they feared the people.
Then Satan entered Judas surnamed Iscariot, who was one of the Twelve.
He went his way and talked with the chief priests and captains on how he could betray him to them,
and they were happy and made an agreement to give him money.
He promised and would look for an opportunity to betray him to them in the absence of the multitude.
The the day of Unleavened Bread came, when the Passover must be killed.
He sent Peter and John, saying, "Go and prepare the Passover, so that we may eat."
They said to him, "Where do you want us to prepare?"
He said to them, "Look, when you have entered the city, a man will meet you there, carrying a pitcher of water. Follow him into the house where he goes into.
"Then you will say to the master of the house, «Where is the guest room where I will eat the Passover with my disciples?»
"He will show you a large upper room furnished. Prepare it there."
They went and found it just as he had said to them, and they prepared the Passover.
When the time had come, he sat down and the twelve apostles with him.
He said to them, "I have intensely longed to eat this Passover with you before I suffer.
"For I say to you that I will not eat of it anymore until it is fulfilled in the Kingdom of God."
He then took the cup, gave thanks, and said, "Take this, and divide it among yourselves.
"For I say to you that I will not drink of the fruit of the vine until the Kingdom of God will come."
He took bread, gave thanks, broke it, and gave to them, saying, "This is my body which is given for you; this do in remembrance of me."
Likewise the cup also after supper, saying, "This cup is the New Covenant in my blood, which is shed for you.
"But note the hand of him who betrays me is with men on the table.
"Truly the Son of Man goes as it was determined, but woe to that man by whom he is betrayed!"
They started to talk it over among themselves which one of them it was who should do this thing.
There was also contention between them which one of them should be considered the greatest.
He said to them, "The kings of the Gentiles rule over them, and those that exercise this authority on them are called benefactors.
"But you are not to be so, but he who is greatest among you, let him be as the younger, and he who is chief, as he who serves.
"For which is greater, he who sits to eat or he who serves? Isn't he who sits to eat? But I am among you as he who serves.
"You are those who stuck by me in my temptations,
and I appoint to you a kingdom as my Father has appointed to me,
so that you may eat and drink at my table in my kingdom, and to sit on thrones judging the twelve tribes of Israel."
Then the Lord said, "Simon, Simon, look, Satan has desired you, so that he may sift you as wheat,
but I have prayed for you, so that your faith doesn't fail. When you have returned [to me], strengthen you brothers."
He then said to him, "Lord, I am ready to go with you, both to prison and to death."
He said to him, "I tell you, Peter, the rooster will not crow this day until you have denied three times that you know me."
He said to them, "When I sent you without a money bag, food bag, or shoes, did you lack anything?" They said, "Nothing."
Then he said to them, "But now he who has a money bag, let him take it and in the same way his food bag. He who doesn't have a sword, let him sell his garment and buy one.
"For I say to you that this is what is written must still be completed in me, "He was reckoned among the transgressors," for the things concerning me have an end."
They said, "Lord, look, here are two swords." He said to them, "It is enough."
Then he came out and went, as he usually did, to the mount of Olives, and his disciples also followed him.
When he was at the place, he said to them, "Pray that you don't enter into temptation."
He had to pull away from them about a stone's throw, kneeled down, and prayed.
Saying, "Father, if you are willing remove this cup from me; nevertheless not my will, but yours be done,"
then an angel appeared to him from heaven, strengthening him.
Being in agony he prayed more earnestly; his sweat was as if it was great drops of blood, falling down to the ground.
When he got up from prayer and come to his disciples, he found them sleeping because of sorrow.
He said to them, "Why do you sleep? Get up and pray, lest you enter into temptation."
While he still was speaking, look, a crowd and he who was named Judas, one of the twelve, went in front of them, and drew close to Jesus to kiss him.
But Jesus said to him, "Judas, do you betray the Son of Man with a kiss?"
When they who were around him, saw what was to follow, they said to him, "Lord, should we strike with the sword?"
One of them smote the high priest's servant and cut off his right ear.
Jesus said answered and said, "That's enough," and he touched his ear and healed him.
Jesus said to the chief priests, the captains of the temple, and the elders who had come to him, "Have you come out as against a thief with swords and clubs?
"When I was daily with you in the temple, you didn't reach out your hands against me, but this is your hour and the power of darkness."
Then they took him, led him, and brought him into the high priest's house. Peter followed in the distance.
When they had started a fire in the midst of the hall and had sat together; Peter sat down among them.
A certain maid watched him as he sat by the fire, looked at him closely, and said, "This man was also with him."
But he denied him saying, "Woman, I do not know him."
After a short time, another saw him and said, "You are also one of them." Peter said, "Man, I am not."
After about one hour later, another confidently affirmed, saying, "It is true, that this [man] was with him, for he is a Galilean."
Peter said, "Man, I do not what you are talking about." Immediately while he was still speaking, the rooster crew.
The Lord turned and looked at Peter; then Peter remembered the word of the Lord, how he had said to him, "Before the rooster crows, you will deny me three times."
Peter went out, and wept bitterly.
Then the men who held Jesus made fun of him and hit him.
After they had blindfolded him, they slugged him on the face and asked him, saying, "Prophesy, who is it that hit you."
And many other blasphemous things they said about him.
As soon as it was day, the elders of the people, the chief priest, and the scribes came together and led him into their council, saying,
"Are you the Messiah? Tell us." He said to them, "If I tell you, you will not believe.
"And if I also ask you, you will not answer me, nor let me go.
"After this the Son of Man will sit at the right hand of the power of God."
Then they all said, "Are you the Son of God then?" He said to them, "You say that I am."
They said, "What need do we have of any more witnesses, for we ourselves have heard from his own mouth."
